content.webTitle: What things do you regard as essential in an employer?

fields.headline: Tell Rise
fields.bodyText: Training is the most important thing. It all sounds great in the brochures but if you really want to compare how good it is, take a look at what's being said about the company on the student message boards. Fahita, Birmingham All that matters to me right now is finding work that will pay off my debts quickly. Once I've done that I'll be able to afford the luxury of thinking about the finer details. Jon, Leeds I'd never work for a company which is involved in activities I didn't agree with, like treating suppliers badly or damaging the environment. However, it's not always easy to get that sort of information. Jack, London I'd prefer to work with other people of my age who share my outlook. At university you feel your ideas are valued and listened to. Friends who've gone to work in companies with lots of older people tell me that they really miss that and hate being treated like their opinions are naïve. Charlie, Kent I dream about holding out for the ideal job with good training, early responsibility, a place where I feel valued. But with tens of graduates chasing even basic jobs what's the point? For most of us there isn't much choice and we'll take what we can get. Callum, Norwich (and this week's £10 prize winner)
